post.author: Mike
post.title: 5 Best Current Sign-up Bonuses for Airline Miles Credit Cards
post.content:
Credit cards that provide handsome bonuses towards airfare costs are becoming more commonplace.  Frequent flyers will benefit from any one of the cards listed below when compared to conventional credit cards.  Pick one out and take advantage of the perks that are uniquely catered towards those who fly the friendly skies.


Chase Sapphire Preferred offers 40,000 bonus points when you use the card for a minimum of $3,000 on purchases within the first 3 months of opening your Chase Sapphire Preferred line of credit. This equates to $500 worth of travel expenses if you use the Chase Ultimate Rewards program for redemption. You can also earn up to 5,000 extra bonus points when using the card within the first three months of opening it. You can also earn double points when you use the Sapphire Preferred card while traveling and dining at restaurants. 1X point per dollar can be earned on all other types of shopping.

There's also a 7% Annual Points Dividend on any new points that you earn when using the card while shopping throughout the entire year. This also applies to points that you have redeemed in the past. You can obtain a 1:1 point transfer ratio with participating frequent travel programs. A 1:1 point transfer ratio means that 1,000 of your Ultimate Rewards points will equate to 1,000 partner miles or points. There will be no transfer fees. Chase Ultimate Rewards program provides a 20% discount from travel purchases when redeemed for airfare, cruises, hotels and vehicle rentals. You can even use the card for chip based shopping when outside of the U.S. through Chase's Chip and Signature feature. There is no beginning annual fee for the first year and beyond that it will cost $95.


The Chase Ink Bold Business Card offers 50,000 bonus points if you spend $5,000 within 3 months of opening the card. When redeemed through Ultimate Rewards, this equates to over $600 towards travel expenses. You'll pay no annual fee for the first year and only $95 afterward. This is a “pay in full” card so there are no interest fees. Foreign transaction fees don't apply either.

You can earn 5X points for each dollar that you spend of your first $50,000 when shopping at office supply retailers, or for cellular or land line phones, cable television and Internet. 2X points are rewarded per dollar on your first $50,000 spent at hotels and gas stations. You'll get 1 point per dollar spent on other purchases. You'll be happy to know that these points never expire. There's also a 20% discount on hotels, car rentals, cruises and airfare. 


The Chase Ink Plus Business Card provides 50,000 bonus points if you spend $5,000 over the first three months. This equates to a generous $625 that you can use towards travel when you redeem by way of the Chase Ultimate Rewards Program. You'll also get 5X points for every dollar on the initial $50,000 spent per year on cell phones, land lines, Internet, office supplies and cable television. You'll get 2X points per dollars pent on the first $50,000 per year at hotels and gas stations.

There's no introductory annual fee and you'll only pay $95 after the first year. You'll be happy to know that you don't have to pay your entire balance per statement period. There's a 1:1 point transfer amongst widely used frequent travel programs. Foreign transaction fees do not apply.


Platinum Card from American Express offers a $200 airline fee credit per year, access to airport lounges via the Airport Club Access Program and zero interest charges because you pay your balance each month. You can earn 40,000 points once you spend $3,000 within the first three months. You also receive a $200 airline fee credit that can be used towards airline fees like bag checking, flight changes, food and drinks.

You can use your points each time you book your flights with the American Express Travel site. You'll receive complimentary benefits and excellent rates at over 750 hotels and resorts. There's also a program for international travelers where airfare bookings result in a discount for a companion traveler. This is available for over 25 airlines. The Platinum Card carries a $450 annual fee.


British Airways Visa Signature Card offers 50,000 bonus "avios" when $2,000 is spent during the first three months of the account. You'll also receive 2 and a half avios for every dollar spent with British Airways and just over 1 avios per dollar spent on anything else. If you spend $30,000 on your card, you'll earn a Travel Together Ticket that is valid for two years. This is a free ticket for not only yourself but also a companion. All of these benefits are available for only $95 per year and a purchase APR of 15.24%.

comment.author: Alton Kevan
comment.content: Restauranting is hard work. It may seem glamourous and fun, but it all boils down to hard work. Ask anyone in the food business, and they will tell you about long hours they put into it. It’s important to understand all the various jobs that are involved in running a restaurant.Deciding what type of restaurant you want to open will depend of a variety of things. Often times people who want to open their own restaurant want to serve food they like to cook, in an atmosphere they feel comfortable in. Other people are interested in Franchising. Restaurant franchises offer a number of benefits, including instant name recognition and built-in marketing. However, many restaurant franchises don't come cheap and owners must be willing to follow a stringent set of rules.
